title: Isolate the Radical terms
text: The radical terms are isolated. We can proceed to the next step.

title: Raise Both Sides Of the Equation To The Power Of The Index
text: $${\sqrt{4v+1}}^2={\sqrt{3v+3}}^2$$ After squaring both sides, we get $$4v+1=3v+3$$.

title: Check For Remaining Radicals
text: Are there any more radicals? No. We can proceed to the next step.

title: Solve For Equation
text: What is the value of v for $$4v+1=3v+3$$?

title: Solve For Equation
text: To solve $$4v+1=3v+3$$, we need to isolate the v on one side by itself. We can subtract 3v both side to remove 3v from the right handside which gives $$v+1=3$$. Then we can subtract 1 both sides to get v isolated on the left side. It gives $$v=2$$.
